First there is the structuralist perspective that handles the society as a whole. Functionalism and conflict theories can be counted to that perspective. Conflict theories divide into Marxism/Neomarxism and Non-Marxist conflict theories. Besides there is interpretative perspective which handles the society as a bunch of little social groups. The sociology of Max Weber, symbolic interactionism and phenomenology are counted to that perspective. Ethnomethodology is also related to phenomenology. Besides there are also gender-based theories.

There are many subdisciplines in sociology: educational sociology, medical, demography, etc. Take a general course or consult a general text. Every field of study has its subfields. One aspect of sociology may be especially appealing to you. For me, it was social gerontology, the sociological study of human aging.
